meanings.sent1: The teddy bear was stuffed with soft cotton.
meanings.sent2: The pillow was fluffy and stuffed with feathers.
meanings.sent3: The overstuffed chair looked comically large in the tiny room.
meanings.sent4: Her bag was like a stuffed treasure chest, full of surprises.
meanings.sent5: The piñata was stuffed with candies, ready to burst open.

meanings.sent1: She stuffed her backpack with books for the trip.
meanings.sent2: He stuffed the turkey with delicious stuffing for Thanksgiving dinner.
meanings.sent3: The clown car was so packed, they had to stuff in one more clown!
meanings.sent4: The magician stuffed the hat with endless scarves, pulling them out one by one.
meanings.sent5: The suitcase was stuffed with clothes, barely able to close.

meanings.definition: To be full to the point of overflowing
meanings.sent1: After the feast, they were stuffed and couldn't eat another bite.
meanings.sent2: The mailbox was stuffed with letters and packages.
meanings.sent3: The party was so fun, they were stuffed with joy and laughter.
meanings.sent4: Her heart was stuffed with love for her new puppy.
meanings.sent5: The balloon was stuffed with air until it popped loudly.
